intro: Koilodepas hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan koilodepas, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky areas. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. Koilodepas hainanense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
